alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 1:55PM MST until August 07 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE PIPELINE BURN SCAR OFF THE GOVERNMENT TANK WATERSHED REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 151 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Pipeline Burn Scar off the Government Tank Watershed. Between 1.00 and 1.50 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rainfall has moved away from the area, however, flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly as water drains off the scar. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Government watershed. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar off the Government Tank Watershed. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar off the Government Tank Watershed. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Hutchison Acres and Doney Park. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 424. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
